chunks.en: How to overcome being very sensitive to sound when falling asleep

When OP is trying to sleep, any slight noise, such as someone talking in the building opposite mine or the strange sound of the wind blowing against the window, will ruin the sleepiness I've worked so hard to build up.
Sometimes I lie in bed at 12:30 AM and can't fall asleep until 3 AM.

Keep your spirit inward, and don't let your conscious mind wander outward.
Use breathing as a method to restrain your restless mind.

If you can't sleep, you can't sleep, it's not a big deal. The feeling of low efficiency the next day caused by insomnia is mostly not caused by the insomnia itself (but because you think you should be very sleepy if you don't sleep well).
Don't take sleep too seriously. The more you value it, the more you want to sleep, the less you can sleep.

@SimleCp I can't hear my phone alarm when I wear earmuffs. The first day I slept with earmuffs, I overslept.
Later, I bought a Xiaomi bracelet to set an alarm, and I wear it when I sleep at night to check my sleep quality.
It's just noise sensitivity.
When I was in college, I could fall asleep in the dormitory even if my roommates were playing cards or playing computer games.

But after getting married, I inexplicably started to become noise-sensitive. As long as I'm at home, I unconsciously and proactively pay attention to any movements made by my neighbors, and then I get very irritable and fall into a vicious cycle.
Sometimes I feel better when I'm in a good mood or very tired during the day.
You can try the following methods to improve it slowly: https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/675878873

@DissDoge #1 Under this guideline, there are two implementation plans: 1. The US military's 2-minute sleep method: Consciously command the whole body to relax, from head to toe.
Do it twice and you can fall asleep (guard your body). 2. Breathing method, increasing the pause between inhalation and exhalation.
By controlling the breathing rhythm, reducing the sympathetic nerves, and increasing the parasympathetic nerve control, you can fall asleep.
